main event: A bright blue, round object was observed moving at a high speed of around 2,500 mph in a straight line from the northwest to the southeast near Taos, New Mexico on October 17, 1952.
interesting points: The object was observed by multiple witnesses, including Air Force personnel, from different locations.
The object was described as being about the size of a volleyball and emitting a bright bluish-green color.
The object's trajectory was described as almost vertical, with a sudden flash as it disappeared from view.
Estimates on the object's size and speed were limited due to the short duration of the sighting, which was only 2-3 seconds.
Local newspapers reported that many other people in the area had observed the same or similar objects, but they were not included in this report.
witnesses: Air Force personnel and other witnesses
